title: Understanding Social Engineering 2
description: A comprehensive guide to common social engineering techniques used by attackers.

lessons.title: What is Social Engineering?
lessons.content: Social engineering is the art of manipulating people to give up confidential information or perform actions that compromise security.

assessment.question: What is a common goal of social engineering?

lessons.title: Types of Social Engineering Attacks
lessons.content:
**Phishing** is a fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by disguising as a trustworthy entity in digital communication. It's one of the most common forms of cyberattacks targeting individuals and organizations.

# 🎯 Common Goals of Phishing Attacks

- Stealing usernames and passwords  
- Gaining access to bank accounts  
- Harvesting personal data for identity theft  
- Installing malware or ransomware  

## 📧 Common Forms of Phishing

- *Email Phishing*: Fake emails asking you to click a link or download an attachment  
- *Spear Phishing*: Targeted phishing aimed at individuals  
- *Smishing*: Phishing through SMS  
- *Vishing*: Voice phishing (scammers calling you)  

## 🕵️‍♂️ How to Recognize Phishing

- Urgent or alarming language ("Your account will be suspended!")  
- Unfamiliar or misspelled email addresses  
- Suspicious links  
- Requests for credentials or financial info  

## ✅ Protect Yourself

- Verify sender identity  
- Don't click shady links  
- Use MFA  
- Keep your software updated  
- Report phishing emails  

> **Example Email**  
> Subject: _Important Account Notice_  
> Body: "Your account has been compromised. Click [here](http://malicious-link.com) to reset your password."

lessons.title: Preventing Social Engineering
lessons.content: Educating employees, using multi-factor authentication, and recognizing suspicious behavior are key defense strategies.
